Definition: to put something (in a lying position)
to go with a mechanical transport
to look, appear (e.g to look good)
to get up (e.g. out of bed)
to quit, to get off (e.g. a bus)
to move (house), to set forth, to depart
to swim, to have a bath
to shop, to buy (many things e.g groceries)
to get on/in (e.g. a bus, a car)
to get to know (e.g. a person)
to take part in, to join in, to follow
to stay overnight (e.g. in a hotel)
